FuncDef:
The auto-defend enable command enables automatic attack source tracing.
The undo auto-defend enable command disables automatic attack source tracing. The auto-defend enable command enables automatic attack source tracing. The undo auto-defend enable command disables automatic attack source tracing. By default, attack source tracing is enabled.
ExtraInfo: A large number of attack packets may attack the device CPU. Attack source tracing enables the device to check attack packets sent to the CPU, trace attack sources, and send logs or alarms to notify the administrator. By default, logs are sent to notify the administrator if attack source tracing is enabled.
